alert.note: Alert for Buchanan; Dickenson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 14 at 9:59PM EST until January 17 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches across the lowlands, and 6 to 10 inches across the mountains of Pocahontas, Randolph, and Webster counties. Ice accumulations of a light glaze across the lowlands, with a light glaze to around one tenth of an inch across the mountains. Winds could gust as high as 35 to 45 mph across the mountains. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Ohio, southwest Virginia, northeast Kentucky and central, northeast, southeast, southern and western West Virginia. * WHEN...From Sunday morning through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. In addition, power outages are possible due to the heavy wet nature of the snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Moderate to heavy snow will likely reduce visibilities at times. Along the higher elevations, winds could gust as high as 35 to 45 mph.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
